creator: dchsr1

content:
Do you really mean you over 800 FOLDERS in your Sent folder - 'cause that would be very unusual and might indicate that there's something wrong - or do you mean you have over 800 MESSAGES in your Sent folder? And are you OK with losing all those messages forever?

If so, simply select them all (click on one, then press CTRL+A to select all) and then press the Delete key. They will then go into your Trash folder. You can then right-click on the Trash folder and choose Empty Trash.

If this is not what you're trying to do, please clarify and give us more details.

By the way, the Unified Folders feature will show all similar folders for multiple email accounts as one virtual folder. For example, all Inbox messages together, all Trash folders together, etc. Some people (not me) find this to be a cleaner presentation. But it's not necessary to use the feature to delete messages.

content:
This is how to adjust the fonts for viewing and composing messages:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General > Language & Fonts > Fonts > click 'Advanced' button

- at the top, set 'Fonts for:' to Latin if it isn't already

- change Proportional and Monospace fonts/sizes to your liking

- set Minimum font size to 14

- at the top, change set 'Fonts for:' to Other Writing Systems

- repeat the process of changing fonts/sizes

- at the bottom, make sure 'Allow messages to use other fonts' is disabled if desired > OK > close the popup
creator: siffemoz

content: This didn't immediately get me where I needed to end up, but it told me where to look and what to change. After a couple of passes at setting both font types and sizes, and especially the "Settings > General > Language & Fonts > Fonts > click 'Advanced' button" where I discovered the "Other Writing Systems," I was able to adjust some settings to make thing a lot better. (Some things are now too large, but I know how to tweak now). Thanks a bunch for the clear guidance.

content:
From the Thunderbird FAQ:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-faq

Where can I get help with using Thunderbird?

Support is available primarily in these ways:

- The web-based Knowledge Base of many articles, for example the article you are reading now.

- Thunderbird's support forum where you can ask a question, or search for issues and answers if you didn't find the answer in the Knowledge Base.

- Various other communication sources, some of which cover special topics.

Thunderbird does not provide direct support via email, fax, chat, phone, remote, nor paid services, so be wary of offers of paid support, and also please report scams that you think are suspicious. Instead we rely on our volunteer community to help users. We hope that you, a Thunderbird user, will become a Thunderbird community member.

content:
Hi,

I know you are frustrating about your email password in Thunderbird.

My experience is that you just start your Thunderbird with your email account. If you changed the password, it will fail to connect to your email server, and pop up to ask your credentials. You can just input your new password then.

Hope this helps.

content: Try this; - click to 'settings>privacy&security' - click the savedpasswords button and then showpasswords. - then, highlight the rows for that account and delete them That should remove the current password

creator: markh2

content:
1. Choose Tools > Developer Tools > Error Console
  2. Paste the expression: 
  openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")
  1. then, press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key.
  2. When prompted, press the Reset button.

This removes all account passwords.
